revised_title: Winds and Physical Factors in the Mesosphere and Lower Thermosphere
tldr: This article reviews the current understanding of air motions and physical factors affecting the general circulation in the mesosphere and lower thermosphere. It discusses the data available for studying winds in the atmosphere and presents mean latitudinal cross-sections of zonal wind at equinoxes and solstices. The article also explores the transition zone between 80 and 120 km, where large-scale irregularities and gravity waves play a significant role in air movements. The study of these phenomena helps in understanding the forces driving the circulation and the physical processes occurring in the lower thermosphere.
